title: SUV Crashes Into Massachusetts Apple Store, Killing One; Investigation into crash, which left 16 others injured, is continuing
text:
A dark-colored SUV plowed through the store's plate-glass window and struck multiple people, Mr. Cruz said at a press conference.

Fire and police officers who responded to the scene found injured people in front of the Apple store and inside, said Hingham Fire Chief Steve Murphy. A few of those inside the shop were pinned against a wall by the 2019 Toyota 4Runner. Officials didn't identify the man who was driving the SUV.

Kevin Bradley, a 65-year-old New Jersey resident, was pronounced dead at the scene, the district attorney's office said Monday afternoon.

Sixteen others were being treated at local hospitals, Mr. Cruz said. Doctors at South Shore Hospital said they received 17 people over 45 minutes. Dr. Christopher Burns, chief of trauma at the hospital, said multiple patients have life-threatening and limb-threatening injuries.

"This morning was an unthinkable morning, and people are trying to get through and process what happened," Mr. Cruz said.

A spokesman for Apple Inc. said the company was working to support its employees and customers. "We are devastated by the shocking events at Apple Derby Street today and the tragic loss of a professional who was on-site supporting recent construction at the store," the spokesman said.

Hingham Police Chief David Jones said details beyond the basics were unavailable, citing the early stages of an investigation into the crash.

Write to Talal Ansari at talal.ansari@wsj.com

SUV Crashes Into Massachusetts Apple Store, Killing One
